department.dept_long_name: Department of the History of Art and Architecture

course.title: The Roman Dinner Party: Proseminar
course.description: The banquet is the key event of Roman elite society. It involved not only luxurious and well-staged food and wine, but proper behavior, a decent setting, luxury furniture, entertainment and enchantment. The seminar discusses visual, archaeological and literary evidence to explore the sensual culture of the Roman dinner party - oscillating between strict social rules, intellectual table talks, the theatrical orchestration of high cuisine, revelry, eroticism and bodily excess.
